channel.title: Quick question about laptop
channel.description: My friend is wanting to switch from XP, but is weary due to the sound buttons on the front of his laptop. Will those lose function with Ubuntu?

item.title: Quick question about laptop
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

i got cs4 working on wine easily, but it’s a little buggy.

the sound buttons on my laptop also worked fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about laptop
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:23, topic:338248”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=434640.msg3193279#msg3193279 date=1272490077]

or wine
[/quote]Haven’t seen any way to effectively run on wine, tried dual booting xp, but that fucked everything up as I’m on 10.04

http://appdb.winehq.org/objectManager.php?sClass=application&iId=17

Nobody wants to use 10 year old photoshop.

Did you even look? There’s shit up there for even CS4…

My bad man I though they would be smart enough to list the current release first, I looked at the pictures and saw the old version. Though CS3 is garbage and CS4 is silver…

But they’re both garbage on Windows anyway, so…?

what?[/quote]

Photoshop was poor after CS2. It was unbelievably slow and you didn’t really get a lot more.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about laptop
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:12, topic:338248”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=434640.msg3192504#msg3192504 date=1272411758]
or wine
[/quote]Haven’t seen any way to effectively run on wine, tried dual booting xp, but that fucked everything up as I’m on 10.04[/quote]

What does being on a certain version of a linux distro have to do with dual-booting another OS? I’m using 10.04 and also have Windows 7 on this laptop.

That being said, if you want to run photoshop inside of linux and it won’t run on WINE, your best bet is installing virtualbox, and running photoshop under windows XP in virtualbox.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about laptop
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

It doesn’t have 3d, it doesn’t have as comprehensive of a magic wand…

I’m just so accustom to PhotoShop that It’s hard to switch to gimp.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about laptop
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:338248”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=434640.msg3192786#msg3192786 date=1272422523]
If you are a professional photoshop user, gimp is probably not what you want…sorry.
[/quote]

Wanna tell us why, without googling? Nobody’s ever got it right yet on the Mopman MITB stop talking shit challenge :D[/quote]
GIMP couldn’t be as polished as Photoshop is. Whether or not that’s the reason you were looking for is beyond me, but it’s the most obvious.
The good news for me is that I don’t do any graphics work.

Read full topic
